case_title: Board Of Trustees Of Port vs Pioneer Engineer And Anr.

appellant.name: Board Of Trustees Of Port
appellant.description: A body corporate, constituted under the Major Port Trusts Act, 1963, based in Mormugao, Goa.

respondents.name: Pioneer Engineer And Anr.
respondents.description: A partnership firm registered under the Indian Partnership Act.

respondents.name: D.H. Rama Rao & J. Raja Rao
respondents.role: Arbitrators appointed under the terms of the contract.

contract_details.contract_purpose: Construction of transit shed and superstructure for a multipurpose general cargo berth.

precedents: Sikkim Subba Associates v. State of Sikkim
Steel Authority of India Ltd. v. J.C. Budharaja
K.P. Poulose v. State of Kerala and Anr.
New India Civil Erectors (P) Ltd. v. Oil and Natural Gas Corporation
Maula Bux v. Union of India
Oil & Natural Gas Corporation v. Saw Pipes Ltd.

key_arguments.appellant: The arbitrators acted arbitrarily, ignored legal precedents, and misinterpreted sections 73 and 74 of the Contract Act.
key_arguments.respondent: The arbitrators correctly assessed damages, followed legal principles, and the contract clause 9.7.1 was a penalty clause requiring fair assessment.

judgment_summary.reasoning: The arbitrators' decision was in line with established legal principles, and their assessment of damages was reasonable.
judgment_summary.final_award: Rs. 29,96,995.85 with 12% interest per annum from the award date until payment.
